page.title: 02Topography of the Block
page.content: The land in the 3x4 block rises from 189 feet above sea level at the S.W. corner _ Fulling Bridge _ to 315 feet above sea level along the East Town Rd. The whole area is open and wind- swept.It lies on a corallian ridge that is exposed along the northern edge of the block as a small disused quarry face - very rich in marine fossils. Overlying the corallian ridge is a layer of clay, exposed at the southern end of the block by the quarry workings of the Blue Circle Cement Group. Covering the clay is greensand making a fertile loamy soil. The area is watered with numerous springs, and the lower lying land is crossed by several small streams which tend to make it waterlogged.
